authorized_values.label: RDB table for storage/manipulation in relational database form

format.python: ( "", " -out " + str(value) )[ value is not None and value != vdef]

dna.prompt: Use DNA/RNA colormaps and/or consensus groups (-dna)

authorized_values.label: Colouring by identity to the first sequence
Colour only when above a given percent similarity
Colours residues by the colour of the class to which they belong

coloring.comment: <{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}div > <{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}ul > <{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}li ><{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}em >Colour all the residues</{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}em>, will colour every residue according to the currently selected palette.</{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}li> <{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}li ><{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}em >Colouring by identity to the first sequence</{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}em>, will colour only those residues that are identical to some reference sequence (usually the query or first row).</{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}li> <{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}li ><{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}em >Colour only when above a given percent similarity</{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}em>, will colour only those residues that belong to a specified physicochemical class that is conserved in at least a specified percentage of all rows for a given column. This defaults to 70% and and may be set to another threshold, eg., -coloring consensus -threshold 80 would specify 80%. Note that the physicochemical classes in question can be confined to individual residues.</{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}li> <{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}li ><{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}em >Colours residues by the colour of the class to which they belong</{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}em>, is like -coloring consensus, but colours residues by the colour of the class to which they belong.</{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}li> </{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}ul> <{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}p >By default, the consensus computation counts gap characters, so that sections of the alignment may be uncolored where the presence of gaps prevents the non-gap count from reaching the threshold. Setting -con_gaps off prevents this, allowing sequence-only based consensus thresholding.</{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}p> </{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}div> </comment>

format.python: ( "" , " -threshold " + str(value) )[ value is not None and value != vdef]
( "" , " -ignore " + str(value) )[ value is not None and value != vdef]

ignore.comment: <text lang="en">Tip: If you want to see only the conserved residues above the threshold (ie., only one type of conserved residue per column), add the option -ignore class. </text> </comment>

authorized_values.label: Colouring by identity to the first sequence (identity)

con_coloring.comment: <{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}div > <{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}p >Colouring of an alignment by consensus determines which residues to colour and the colours to use based on</{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}p> <{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}ol > <{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}li >the consensus threshold chosen for the colouring operation,</{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}li> <{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}li >a consideration of the common physicochemical properties of the residues in that column,</{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}li> <{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}li >the chosen colour scheme.</{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}li> </{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}ol> </{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}div> </comment>

con_threshold.prompt: Consensus line thresholds (in range 50..100) (separated by commas) (-con_threshold)

format.python: ( "" , " -con_threshold " + str(value) )[ value is not None and value != vdef]
( "" , " -con_ignore " + str(value) )[ value is not None and value != vdef]

range.comment: <text lang="en">You must enter a string composed of two numbers separated by comma </text> </comment>

format.python: ( "" , " -maxident " + str(value) )[ value is not None and value != vdef]

ref.prompt: Use row N or row identifier as percent identity reference (-ref)

keep_only.prompt: Keep only the rows from start to end (separated by comma) (-keep)
keep_only.comment: <text lang="en">You must enter a string composed of two numbers separated by comma </text> </comment>

disc.prompt: Discard rows from start to end (separated by comma) (-disc)
disc.comment: <text lang="en">You must enter a string composed of two numbers separated by comma </text> </comment>

nops.comment: <text lang="en">You must enter a string composed of two numbers separated by comma </text> </comment>

width.prompt: Paginate in N columns of alignment (-width)

gap.prompt: Use this character as the gap (-gap)

register.prompt: Output multi-pass alignments with columns in register (-register)

strand.prompt: Report only these query strand orientations (-strand)

maxpval.prompt: Ignore hits with p-value more than N (-maxpval)

minscore.prompt: Ignore hits with score less than N (-minscore)

maxeval.prompt: Ignore hits with p-value more than N -- Blast2 only (-maxeval)

minbits.prompt: Ignore hits with bits less than N (-minbits)

cycle.prompt: Process the Nth cycle of a multipass search (-cycle)

format.python: ( "" , " -pagecolor " + str(value) )[ value is not None and value != vdef]
( "" , " -textcolor " + str(value) )[ value is not None and value != vdef]
( "" , " -linkcolor " + str(value) )[ value is not None and value != vdef]
( "" , " -alinkcolor " + str(value) )[ value is not None and value != vdef]
( "" , " -vlinkcolor " + str(value) )[ value is not None and value != vdef]
( "" , " -alncolor " + str(value) )[ value is not None and value != vdef]
( "" , " -labcolor " + str(value) )[ value is not None and value != vdef]

bold.prompt: Use bold emphasis for coloured residues (-bold)

format.python: ( "" , " -css on" )[ value is not None and value != vdef]

comment: <{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}div > <{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}p >MSAProbs is an open-source protein multiple sequence ailgnment algorithm, achieving the stastistically highest alignment accuracy on popular benchmarks: <{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}a href="http://www-bio3d-igbmc.u-strasbg.fr/balibase/">BALIBASE</{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}a>, <{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}a href="http://www.drive5.com/muscle/prefab.htm">PREFAB</{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}a>, <{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}a href="http://bioinformatics.vub.ac.be/databases/databases.html">SABMARK</{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}a>, <{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}a href="http://www.compbio.dundee.ac.uk/Software/Oxbench/oxbench.html">OXBENCH</{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}a>, compared to ClustalW, MAFFT, MUSCLE, ProbCons and Probalign.</{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}p> </{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}div> </comment>
